etymologies: early 18th century. From classical Latin ēvolvent-, ēvolvēns, present participle of ēvolvere

definitions: That evolves or causes to evolve.

notes.text: "evolvent line" noun Geometry. Obsolete a straight line, perpendicular to a given curve, joining a point on the curve to its centre of curvature at that point.

definitions: In Sankhya philosophy: (of a principle of nature or being) that gives rise to other principles of nature or being; that is the cause of the existence of other phenomena.

In Sankhya philosophy: a principle of nature or being that gives rise to other principles of nature or being; a cause of the existence of other phenomena. Sometimes: specifically such a principle which itself derives from another, and is not a root cause of being.
